board.p0: This mode finds a path between green and red square
board.p1: In this case, you can choose an algorithm to find a path between green and red square
board.p2: You have to choose the algorithm to enable Run Button
board.p3: Green dot is a starting point, red point is a finish point
board.p4: You can set a wall by clicking on board, delete again the same point to delete wall
board.p6: You can set your starting point and own finish point by selecting on the right
board.p7: To Run the algorithm again you have to clean the board

map.p0: This mode finds connections between black dock cities
map.p1: In this case, you can choose the algorithm to find a path between cities (black dots)
map.p2: You have to choose the algorithm to enable Run Button
map.p3: Each algorithm contains its extra functionalities
map.p4: If you enable 'Add Custom Click' you can click on the map and add your city (red dot)
map.p5: In 'Sort' algorithm you can add custom weight to your clicked city (red dot)
map.p6: In 'TSG' if you enable 'Add Custom Click', you will be able to select starting city
map.p7: TSG means - Traveling Salesman Greedy Algorithm
map.p8: To Run the algorithm again you have to clean the map

combo.p1: In this case, it will find path shortest path between cities with TSG
combo.p2: Then will find a path and omit walls to each city sequentially with Dijkstra
combo.p3: In this case, you have to choose at least two cities
combo.p4: Just like in board you can add  a wall by clicking on the board
combo.p5: Algorithm Dijkstra will omit every wall, TSG will find the shortest path in a straight line despite walls
combo.p7: To Run the algorithm again you have to clean the map and clean the board

add.p0: This mode allows users to add their own city and explore the map
add.p1: You can only add one city per account
add.p2: If you want to change the position of your city, you need to remove it first
add.p3: Each city can be located in a different biome
add.p4: Adding a City over the see is not possible
add.p5: When you hover over a city, you will receive information about that particular city
add.p6: You can view all discovered biomes using the pagination component
add.p7: The pagination component displays 2 biomes per page
